results.title: It Follows
results.creator_credit: Two Flints, Northern Lights Films, Animal Kingdom, David Robert Mitchell, Michael Perry, Erik Rommesmo, Laura D. Smith, Kimberly Leitz, Rebecca Green and David Kaplan
results.brief_description: After carefree teenager Jay sleeps with her new boyfriend, Hugh, for the first time, she learns that she is the latest recipient of a fatal curse that is passed from victim to victim via sexual intercourse.

constellations_other.name: Electric Sound Supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_other.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Two Flints, Northern Lights Films, Animal Kingdom, David Robert Mitchell, Michael Perry, Erik Rommesmo, Laura D. Smith, Kimberly Leitz, Rebecca Green and David Kaplan
results.description: After carefree teenager Jay sleeps with her new boyfriend, Hugh, for the first time, she learns that she is the latest recipient of a fatal curse that is passed from victim to victim via sexual intercourse. Death, Jay learns, will creep inexorably toward her as either a friend or a stranger. Jay’s friends don’t believe her seemingly paranoid ravings, until they too begin to see the phantom assassins and band together to help her flee or defend herself.
description_for_label: After carefree teenager Jay sleeps with her new boyfriend, Hugh, for the first time, she learns that she is the latest recipient of a fatal curse that is passed from victim to victim via sexual intercourse. Death, Jay learns, will creep inexorably toward her as either a friend or a stranger. Jay’s friends don’t believe her seemingly paranoid ravings, until they too begin to see the phantom assassins and band together to help her flee or defend herself.

results.title: It feels like you're left out of the world: experiencing learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Robert Anderson Associates and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Learning Series”.
Children speak of their attitudes towards their own learning disabilities, and of the way in which their life has been affected by these disabilities. Articulates the personal and social consequences of having a learning problem - the feeling of being a failure is a classroom lesson that many of these children never forget. Shows that the children given time and special help, their problems can be overcome.

results.title: It doesn't hurt to know
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: Discusses the symptoms, causes and prevention of P.I.D. - Pelvic Inflammatory Disease, a sexually transmitted infection causing infertility in young women. Stresses the importance of check-ups, the use of condoms and honest communication between partners.

results.title: It didn't have to happen
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the careless worker who scorns safety devices on modern machinery endangers not only his own life but the lives of fellow workers. It portrays a careless employee and the tragic result of his slipshod methods. Designed to show employers in industry why guards are put on machines and how they should be used.

results.title: It couldn't happen
results.brief_description: Burns are one of the most frequent types of domestic accidents, particularly to children. The variety of situations in which accidental burning can happen are explored, the elements that are involved and how they can be minimised. In particular, it details the importance of the material in, and the design of children’s clothes.

results.title: It came to stay
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the motor industry in Australia from approximately 1904 and shows the significant changes that have taken place in this field. The film shows the production of motor cars from molten metal to finished product.

results.title: It all starts today = Ca commence aujourd'hui [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, Alain Sarde, Frederic Bourboulon, TF1 Films productions, Little Bear Films and Les Films Alain Sarde
results.brief_description: Bernard Tavernier’s “It all starts today” is a compassionate portrait of one man’s commitment and determination to challenge a social and bureaucratic system mired in inadequacies and injustice. Daniel Lefebvre (Philippe Torreton) is a kindergarten teacher who is passionately committed to his job but is also frequently demoralised by the social milieu in which he operates - an economically depressed mining town in France where the parents are mostly jobless, suffering from acute poverty as well as, in many cases, alcoholism, abuse and destitution. Lefebvre is also in conflict with the social service workers, who being critically under-resourced themselves, fail to respond to his urgent calls for assistance, and the local politicians who sacrifice the needs of the abject poor to boost their financial standing. Tavernier (Round Midnight, Safe Conduct, D’Artagnan’s Daughter) displays a true flair for social realism, but he also ably extracts humour and grace from his protagonists, steering away from tabloid exploitation of their depressing circumstances. Philippe Torreton puts in an admirable performance as a man who faces the problems in his personal and professional life with dignity, but also frequently betrays the seething frustration of an idealistic individual operating within a flawed bureaucracy. In French with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: It all starts today = Ca commence aujourd’hui [Widescreen] [NTSC]
